Class BufferPool 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----BufferPool
public class BufferPool
extends Object
Generic Buffer Queue - Designed for Channels 1, 2 and 3

Version:
10.10.1998, 12.06.1998
Author:
Ken Schulz

eb
emptyBuffer
ifb
inputFullBuffer
ofb
outputFullBuffer

BufferPool()
Default constructor

getEM()
removes and returns an empty buffer from the eb queue eb must be checked before this method is used
getIN()
removes and returns an inputFullBuffer if contains data ifb must be checked before this method is used
getOUT()
removes and returns an outputFullBuffer if contains data ofb must be checked before this method is used
isEMEmpty()
checks to see if the emptyBuffer is empty
isINEmpty()
checks to see if the inputFullBuffer is empty
isOUTEmpty()
checks to see if the outputFullBuffer is empty
putEM(String)
places an empty buffer on the emptyBufferQueue
putIN(String)
places a new inputFull Buffer on the inputFullBuffer Queue
putOUT(String)
places a new outputFull Buffer on the outputFullBuffer Queue

emptyBuffer 
 protected Queue emptyBuffer
inputFullBuffer 
 protected Queue inputFullBuffer
outputFullBuffer 
 protected Queue outputFullBuffer
eb 
 protected int eb
ifb 
 protected int ifb
ofb 
 protected int ofb

BufferPool 
 public BufferPool()
Default constructor

getEM 
 public String getEM()
removes and returns an empty buffer from the eb queue eb must be checked before this method is used

Returns:
String of an empty buffer
getIN 
 public String getIN()
removes and returns an inputFullBuffer if contains data ifb must be checked before this method is used

Returns:
String of empty buffer
getOUT 
 public String getOUT()
removes and returns an outputFullBuffer if contains data ofb must be checked before this method is used

Returns:
String of empty buffer
putEM 
 public void putEM(String newEM)
places an empty buffer on the emptyBufferQueue

Parameters:
newEM - is the empty buffer that will be placed back onto the emptyBuffer queue
putIN 
 public void putIN(String newIN)
places a new inputFull Buffer on the inputFullBuffer Queue

Parameters:
newIN - is a new inputFull buffer to be added to the queue
putOUT 
 public void putOUT(String newOUT)
places a new outputFull Buffer on the outputFullBuffer Queue

Parameters:
newOUT - is a new outputFull buffer to be added to the queue
isEMEmpty 
 public boolean isEMEmpty()
checks to see if the emptyBuffer is empty

Parameters:
return - True if the emptyBuffer is empty
isINEmpty 
 public boolean isINEmpty()
checks to see if the inputFullBuffer is empty

Parameters:
return - True if the inputFullBuffer is empty
isOUTEmpty 
 public boolean isOUTEmpty()
checks to see if the outputFullBuffer is empty

Parameters:
return - True if the outputFullBuffer is empty
